solution.text:
As the ones place digit is 0, it follows the divisibility test of 10 and is divisible by 10.
Since it is 0, it also follows the divisibility test of 5 (0 or 5 at ones place) and is divisible by 5.
Lastly it also follows the divisibility test of 2, so it is divisible by 2 as well (0,2,4,6,8 at the ones place).
\( \Rightarrow \) Therefore, it is divisible by 2,5 and 10.

content.text: Look at the number _{j}__{k}__{l}_0 and check all that apply.
